Title: Marketing Data Management Coordinator
FullDescriptions:
Location: Office Park (1699)
Requisition #: 34751

JOB SUMMARY
Oversees the day-to-day financials and operations of the Marketing and External Communications department including invoice processing, Accounts Payable reconciliation, and monthly reporting for leadership. Provides project management and workflow support to department, ensuring accuracy and appropriate usage of department’s database by internal team members.

EDUCATION
High school diploma or equivalent
CERTIFICATION SUMMARY
No professional certifications required
EXPERIENCE*
Four years of experience in budget management, including financial tracking, reconciliation, and reporting
Database administration experience
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS*
Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, marketing/communications or related field
Experience with Workfront and/or Filemaker Pro
One year experience in project coordination
KNOWLEDGE SKILLS & ABILITIES*
Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other report-writing programs
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES*
Monitors the financial operations of the department, working closely with staff, Finance, Accounts Payable, and department leadership to ensure accuracy of data for system reporting.
Maintains and administers the department’s internal database to track the day-to-day finances, including accruals, expenses, invoices, and vendor payments; processes and reconciles invoices against budget; updates, tracks, and maintains workflow hierarchy changes for budget/cost center alignment.
Assigns budget to area leads within department, based upon direction from director, and tracks/ensures expenditures are appropriately coded and in line with overall department budget.
Serves as system administrator of department’s project management tool; provides support and enforcement of project workflow processes, user access, database security, and system updates with database provider.
Creates department financial and annual planning reports for management review.
Trains and educates department staff on Accounts Payable changes/updates to ensure proper coding and budgetary reporting.
Participates in managing departmental or System projects requiring data gathering, investigation, and reporting.
May manage key special projects, marketing and communications business activities and initiatives, providing a high-level of operational support to the team and department leaders.
SYSTEM RESPONSIBILITIES*
Safety: Practices proper safety techniques in accordance with hospital and departmental policies and procedures. Responsible for the reporting of employee/patient/visitor injuries or accidents, or other safety issues to the supervisor and in the occurrence notification system.

Compliance: Monitors and ensures compliance with all regulatory requirements, organizational standards, and policies and procedures related to area of responsibility. Identifies potential risk areas within area of responsibility and supports problem resolution process. Maintains records of compliance activities and reports compliance activities to the Compliance Office.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by the personnel so classified.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS*
Ability to lift up to 15 lbs independently not to exceed 50 lbs without assistance
Bending/Stooping - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Climbing - Not Present
Hearing/Speaking - Effective communication with employees, supervisors/managers and staff. Effective communications with patients and visitors, as required.
Lifting - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Pushing/Pulling - Not Present
Sitting - Frequently (activity or condition exists from 1/3 to 2/3 of time)
Standing - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Walking - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
WORKING CONDITIONS*
No potential for exposure to blood and body fluids
About Us:
Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta has been 100 percent committed to kids for more than 100 years. A not-for-profit organization, Children’s is dedicated to making kids better today and healthier tomorrow.
With 3 hospitals, 27 neighborhood locations and a total of 638 beds, Children’s is the largest healthcare provider for children in Georgia and one of the largest pediatric clinical care providers in the country. Children’s offers access to more than 70 pediatric specialties and programs and is ranked among the top children’s hospitals in the country by U.S. News & World Report.
Children’s has been ranked on Fortune magazine’s list of “100 Best Companies to Work For” for fourteen consecutive years and named one of the “100 Best Companies” by Working Mother magazine. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefit package that supports our mission, vision and values. We are proud to offer an array of programs and services to our employees that have distinguished us as a best place to work in the country. Connect to our mission of making kids better today and healthier tomorrow.
Have questions about the recruitment process? Check out What to Expect.
Address: 1699 Tullie Circle, Atlanta, GA 30329
Function: Marketing/Communications - Marketing/Communications

Title: Database Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Job Title: Database Engineer

Position Type: Full Time

Location: Marietta, GA

Begin a New Career with a Purpose at Sterling

We’re a fast-moving world leader in cloud-based background screening and identity services. Our clients use our services to create safer workplaces, build trusted brands and protect vulnerable populations. We are financially thriving, investing in growth and grounded in authenticity. If you are motivated and passionate, you will love working here. Apply today!

We have great people here and are looking for more. Come join us - you will love it!

As a Database Engineer, you are responsible for becoming a subject matter expert on our data and its capabilities, having a high-touch experience working with internal customers on a daily basis. Every day, our amazing team provides solutions to prospects and clients, gaining their trust while enhancing long-term partnerships. When you join us, you'll be part of a high-performing team that truly values your contributions will allow you to grow within the business. If you are a self-starter who can meet the challenge, keep reading!

This Is The Job For You, If:

You have a great ability to design and implement complex integrations and orchestrate within the enterprise to support master data integrity, application data needs, and analytics.
You enjoy developing and implementing a methodology for the ongoing assessment of performance and security of the enterprise data environment, ensuring a highly-secured, highly-resilient environment.
You have the ability and knowledge to develop complex logic (advanced SQL, triggers, functions, transaction isolation levels, stored procedures, etc.), in support of application and integrations requirements.
Coordination is key, you can coordinate with others to integrate with projects, applications and/or initiatives.
You are an expert when it comes to providing database and SQL Tuning expertise through recommendations to application developers, vendors and other core teams
Troubleshooting database issues including collecting information through traces and other logging facilities is something that come natural to you
When it comes to providing architectural/database technical expertise to team concerning methods, procedures, and standards to be used during design and development phases you are a SME
You use your previous experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, availability / connectivity, replication issues, security issues, etc.
You are up for a challenge and can handle other duties and responsibilities as they are sent your way!

This Is What We're Looking For:

4+ years working in database engineering and solution delivery
5+ years’ experience working with MS SQL Server
3+ years SQL development – ability to write and troubleshoot SQL Code and design (stored procedures, functions, tables, views, triggers, indexes, constraints, transaction isolation levels), and experience in creating database architecture with associated schemas as part of a software design process.
Knowledge of source control
Good interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure, team-oriented, collaborative environment, playing multiple roles on any given work day.
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language with solid technical documentation skills
Must be well-organized, responsible, work effectively in a project management framework.

Why Sterling:
Our mission is to provide the foundation of trust and safety our clients need to create great environments for their most essential resource, people. We believe everyone has the right to feel safe.

Most importantly, we make decisions and live by our values:

It’s All About People
The Client is Always in the Room
Deliver Results: They Matter
Start with Trust and Prove It Everyday

Why You Should Join:
You'll Grow. Make an Impact. Build Community.


You will have the freedom to create and grow professionally, individually and as a culture
GREAT Paid Time Off with donations program
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
Generous benefits including medical, dental, vision and more only sweeten the experience
Health Club Discount
401k with MATCH
Flexible Work Schedules
Philanthropic Opportunities

In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working and we think you will too.

Check out our current job openings: http://www.sterlingcheck.com/About/Careers

Follow us:
www.instagram.com/sterlingcheck

www.linkedin.com/company/sterlingcheck

www.facebook.com/SterlingCheck/

Title: Systems Engineer Senior - AMMM Program
FullDescriptions:
The Logistics Support Analysis (LSA) Database Administrator directly supports AMMM Reliability and Maintainability Engineer’s operations by assuring the integrity of data generated/stored within the database and delivering data per contract requirements. Familiarity with Failure Modes, Effects and Criticality Analysis (FMECA), Reliability Centered Maintenance Analysis (RCMA) and Maintenance Task Analysis (MTA) processes. The successful candidate will serve as the point of contact in LSA discussions and works closely with Oracle and Sybase Database Administrators maintaining the internal databases and applications.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Knowledge of databases, database relationships, interfaces, and integration techniquesDatabase support (maintaining user accounts, submitting errors, enhancements, etc., performing Admin functions)Conduct data transfers between systems (internal and external), provide user access to data, assist with configuring assets to support user needs, and troubleshoot assets as neededSupport testing, debugging, and implementation of ATLAS software releases and database tools, i.e. Microsoft AccessExperience with MS Office toolsetProgramming experience related to Excel macros, SQL queries, and Visual Basic
Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline
Desired Skills:
SQL programming and Relational Database experience, MIL-STD-1388-2B, GEIA-STD-0007, and Systems and Network understanding.

Ability to solve routine problems of limited scope and complexity following established procedures with work closely supervised.

Aircraft maintenance experience is desired.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills are highly desirable.

Title: Actuarial Analyst Employee Benefits
FullDescriptions:
Job Details
Description
Independent for over 70 years, Milliman delivers market-leading services and solutions to clients worldwide. Today, we are helping companies take on some of the world’s most critical and complex issues, including retirement funding and healthcare financing, risk management and regulatory compliance, data analytics and business transformation.

Through a team of professionals ranging from actuaries to clinicians, technology specialists to plan administrators, we offer unparalleled expertise in employee benefits, investment consulting, healthcare, life insurance and financial services, and property and casualty insurance.

Job Responsibilities
Actuarial analyst position supports our consulting to employers and brokers relating to employee health benefits. Responsibilities include plan design and contribution modeling, rate setting, budgeting/forecasting, administration of RFPs, reporting and project management. Requires ability to work on several projects at once (typically 2 - 4 projects) and interact effectively with colleagues on all levels. Continued progress on actuarial exams is expected.

Develop and utilize actuarial models; analyze healthcare costs and utilization data; develop reports; participate in client calls/meetings; support project management. Requires proficiency with spreadsheets and database applications and an understanding of programming (SAS/SQL).
Qualifications
Behaviors
Preferred
Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
Motivations
Preferred
Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
Education
Required
Bachelors or better in Actuarial Science or related field.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

Title: Manager, Database Services
FullDescriptions:
Job Description:
Carter's, Inc. is the largest branded marketer in North America of apparel exclusively for babies and young children. The Company owns the Carter's and OshKosh B'gosh brands, two of the most recognized brands in the marketplace. These brands are sold in leading department stores, national chains, and specialty retailers domestically and internationally. They are also sold through more than 1,000 Company-operated stores in the United States, Canada, and Mexico and online at www.carters.com, www.oshkoshbgosh.com, and www.cartersoshkosh.ca. The Company's Just One You and Genuine Kids brands are available at Target, its Child of Mine brand is available at Walmart, and its Simple Joys brand is available on Amazon. The Company also owns Skip Hop, a global lifestyle brand for families with young children. Carter's is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Additional information may be found at www.carters.com.
Database Administration and Support: (50%)
Supports Carter’s enterprise database platforms including Oracle and MS SQL Server
Controls migration of programs, database changes, reference data changes, and menu changes throughout the development life cycle
Implements and enforces database security and logging
Conducts database re-organizations, purging, and other maintenance activities to maximize performance and uptime
Supports system workload migrations and resource capacity planning
Supports scheduled enterprise database patching and upgrades
Adheres to corporate build/data structure standards and performance tuning best practices
Provides and reviews performance and capacity metrics
Partners with systems administrators and engineers regarding platform considerations and physical architecture
Configures and maintains enterprise database monitoring tools and notifications
Deploys and validates enterprise database backup and disaster recovery services
Implements high availability database architectures, clustering, and replication
Maintains enterprise software licensing compliance within supported environments
Ensures all system deployments adhere to SOX, PCI, and cyber-security standards
Project Management / Project and Service Delivery: (50%)
Manages staffing, assignment, and prioritization of full time and contingent resources in support of Carter’s project portfolio
Supervises all operational and project-oriented activities of his/her team in accordance with Carter’s project methodology, corporate/compliance standards, business SLA’s, and expected deliverables/timelines
Establishes, communicates, and maintains annual performance goals of his/her direct reports over the course of a calendar year
Evaluates performance annually/semi-annually via performance reviews of his/her direct reports
Ensures that his/her team consistently delivers high quality, timely, and effective support to all internal and external partners
Ensures responsiveness of technical teams and contributes during root cause analysis and/or problem resolution
Leads and promotes innovation across his/her team and within his/her area of responsibility; fosters an environment of innovation
Required Experience:

Required 8+ years’ experience with all aspects of Database Administration and development, particularly Oracle and MS SQL databases.
Preferred Bachelor’s Degree and/or combination of education and technical certification(s)
Required 4+ years’ experience managing technical resources
Required 4+ years’ experience in database design and architecture
Manages three to five direct reports and/or contractors
Functions as technical back upon his/her team and provide hands-on assistance during high volume periods
Works in close coordination with a wide range of IT organizational teams and various levels of organizational leadership
Provides systems support for all Carter’s corporate and remote offices and data centers
Assists IT Director(s) and VP-level leadership with the management of the overall IT expense and capital budget
Demonstrated excellence in customer service and communications
Ability to collaborate with functional teams, leadership, and business partners

Microsoft SQL Server
Oracle on Exadata Database Machine
MySQL
Toad
Oracle SQL Developer
Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM)
MS SQL Server Clustering / AlwaysOn / High Availability

IBM DB2

Required experience managing project plans utilizing enterprise project development and tracking tools

Title: Database Administrator, Mid
FullDescriptions:
Key Role:
Perform data storage, security, integrity, and performance management functions for supported Database Management Systems (DBMS). Prepare detailed reports that may include system requirements such as concurrent usage factors, data storage requirements, and response rates and discuss procedures for processing data through the use of DBMS, including relational data bases. Apply expertise in data structures and data structure within a DBMS as well as methods for defining data relationships. Evaluate and communicate database design tradeoffs, performance levels, and space allocation requirements. Set up data warehouse, data marts, metadata registries, and scanning operations, including setup, managing, indexing, and bookmarking. Conduct quality control and auditing of databases in a client server environment to ensure the accurate and appropriate use of data advise users on access to various client server databases. Design, implement, and maintain complex databases with respect to Job Control Language (JCL), access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, and statistical methods.
Basic Qualifications:3+ years of experience with database administration or database engineeringExperience with designing, configuring, tuning and administering SQL Server databasesExperience with database architecture and designExperience with the maintenance of relational databases and associated administration toolsExperience with enterprise-scale data migrationsExperience developing and modifying Transact SQL code, stored procedures, and triggersExperience with SAS programming algorithms
BA or BS degree
Additional Qualifications:BA or BS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Biostatistics, C, Data Science, or Epidemiology

FullDescriptions:

Must be creative, analytical thinker and have the ability to lead a team of database professionals. Must be an effective communicator. Have the ability to plan information system strategies and make presentations.

Title: Database Administrator
FullDescriptions:
Logistics done differently.
At XPO Logistics, we know that state-of-the-art technology drives our success, and we want to put you behind the wheel. As the Database Administrator, you will be responsible for troubleshooting problems, implementing solutions and monitoring the effectiveness of the databases that keep XPO running smoothly. If you love a challenge and have a competitive spirit fueled by achievement, we have an opportunity for you to grow with XPO.

Pay, benefits and more.
We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.

What you’ll do on a typical day:
Design, install, configure, support and manage SQL servers and databases in clustered and standalone environments
Identify and resolve performance problems within the databases and operating systems
Work closely with our Development Teams, offering best practices for optimal code development
Implement database backup and recovery configurations that meet/exceed our customer specifications
Perform upgrades and patches to SQL server databases
Proactively manage database support issues and take corrective actions
What you need to succeed at XPO:
At a minimum, you’ll need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
5 years of database administration experience with SQL Server (version 2012 minimum)
An understanding of Microsoft Server Operating Systems
Experience with SQL server clustering, availability groups, replication and log shipping
SSAS, SSIS and SSRS experience
Expert capabilities in SQL server performance tuning and query
Experience using monitoring tools and setting proper alerting thresholds
Strong understanding of relational data modeling
Expert knowledge in T-SQL
It’d be great if you also have:
Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
Microsoft certifications
Experience with SQL Server on Linux Operating Systems
Some experience with versions of SQL Server above version 2012
Microsoft Azure experience
OLAP cubes and MDX development experience
Be part of something big.

XPO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make XPO a great place to work.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

Title: CDC Enteric Bacterial Pathogens Fellowship
Qualifications:
Comfortable working with computers
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word
Requirement:
Degree: Bachelor's Degree received within the last 60 month(s).
Discipline(s):
Communications and Graphics Design (1 )
Computer Sciences (2 )
Life Health and Medical Sciences (3 )
Other Physical Sciences (1 )
FullDescriptions:
Organization Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Reference Code CDC-DFWED-2019-0216
How to Apply
A complete application consists of:
An application
Transcripts – Click here for detailed information about acceptable transcripts
A current resume/CV, including academic history, employment history, relevant experiences, and publication list
One educational or professional recommendation
All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.
If you have questions, send an email to ORISE.CDC.NCEZID@orau.org. Please include the reference code for this opportunity in your email.
Application Deadline 11/4/2019 3:00:00 PM Eastern Time Zone
Description
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling-basis.
A research opportunity is currently available in the Division of Foodborne, Waterborne, and Environmental Diseases (DFWED) in the National Center for Emerging and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases (NCEZID) at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in Atlanta, Georgia.
The Enteric Diseases Laboratory Branch (EDLB) mission is to contribute to the preparedness and response to foodborne and diarrheal diseases in the United States and abroad by facilitating laboratory detection, identification and characterization of enteric bacterial pathogens. Under the guidance of a mentor, the selected participant will have the opportunity to learn how to use the NARMS database, how to organize and manage electronic database upload, storage, and quality control of antimicrobial susceptibility. The participant will also learn how to use other Specimen Management System such as ELIMS.
The participant will have the opportunity to learn about antimicrobial susceptibility testing (AST) methods, including broth microdilution, disk diffusion, Etest methods. The participant will also learn how to use the oCelloScope, the new antimicrobial susceptibility testing assay that was optimized in the National Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance Laboratory. It’s a life cell imaging system for monitoring of biological growth and development that will help us understand behavior of strains in response to antimicrobial drugs. Optical screening for rapid antimicrobial testing using the oCelloScope provides a new approach for rapidly detecting phenotypic antimicrobial resistance as an accurate and sensitive antimicrobial susceptibility testing (AST) method for assessment of in vitro activity of antibiotics. It’s an easy-to-use automated microscope facilitating high-throughput testing and robust time-lapse studies. It also facilitates capturing the early stages in microbial growth that could not otherwise be detected with conventional OD measurements.
This program, administered by ORAU through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education, was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and CDC. The initial appointment can be up to one year, but may be renewed upon recommendation of CDC contingent on the availability of funds. The participant will receive a monthly stipend commensurate with educational level and experience. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. The appointment is full-time at CDC in the Atlanta, Georgia, area. Participants do not become employees of CDC, DOE or the program administrator, and there are no employment-related benefits.
Qualifications
The qualified candidate should have received a bachelor's degree in one of the relevant fields. Degree must have been received within five years of the appointment start date.
Preferred skills:
Comfortable working with computers
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word
Eligibility Requirements
Degree: Bachelor's Degree received within the last 60 month(s).
Discipline(s):
Communications and Graphics Design (1 )
Computer Sciences (2 )
Life Health and Medical Sciences (3 )
Other Physical Sciences (1 )

FullDescriptions:
Quality Assurance Specialist II (#16053)
Cherokee Nation Operational Solutions (CNOS) provides a complete line of medical equipment and supplies along with innovative office products and services to businesses and health care facilities throughout North America. Wholly owned by Cherokee Nation, Cherokee Nation Operational Solutions is part of the Cherokee Nation Businesses’ family of companies.
For more company information, visit our site at http://cherokee-os.com/Pages/Home.aspx
We are seeking a Quality Assurance Specialist to support auditing, reporting, implementation, oversight, maintenance and continuous improvement of Quality System processes for laboratories performing diagnostic testing of patient specimens, surveillance, research activities, IVD and RUO manufacturing, etc. The Quality Assurance Specialist will assist the QA team with the continuous improvement of a Laboratory Quality System that complies with Clinical Laboratory Improvements Amendment (CLIA), ISO 9001, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) per 21 CFR 820, and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) per 21 CFR Part 58 as appropriate.
The US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)/Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)/National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases (NCIRD)/ Influenza Division (ID) requires support in the areas of laboratory surveillance, monitoring of novel and antiviral-resistant influenza viruses, and establishing more effective antiviral drugs and treatment.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
The contractor will apply specialized skills to conduct work including one or multiple of the following responsibilities:

Assist with document control and training related to Quality Systems

Monitor competency assessment completion by each team

Review of batch records and design history records, as needed

Assist with root cause analysis and preparation of corrective actions concerning audit findings
Communicate progress orally and in writing with technical monitor and others

No supervisory/management authority.
Education and/or Experience
Mandatory
MS or BS Degree in biology, microbiology, virology, biochemisty, or other life science
Have at least 1-year quality assurance experience in microbiology/diagnostic CLIA and or ISO certified laboratories, medical device manufacturing, or pharmaceutical industry or similar
Must have appropriate knowledge of regulatory practices and other guidance documents
Demonstrated interpersonal and management skills with ability to work collaboratively with other scientists and laboratorians
Highly Desired

Experience generating standard operating procedures for QC testing
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

FullDescriptions:
Position Description:

At National Vision, we believe everyone deserves to see their best to live their best. We help people by making quality eye care and eyewear more affordable and accessible.

National Vision, Inc. (NVI) is one of the largest optical retailers in the United States. We offer an innovative culture where training is a priority, hard work is praised, and career growth is a reality.

Right now we're looking for a Instructional Design Specialist to join our growing team.

The Instructional Design Specialist (IDS) is responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and evaluating training programs for retail management and associates. This position will develop creative learning solutions using multiple delivery methods (e-learning, print, instructor-led, virtual classroom, and blended solutions). In addition the IDS will collaborate closely and effectively with peers, leaders, and interdepartmental partners to translate business requirements into learning requirements, build learning solutions that align with desired outcomes, and ensure learning deliverables are in accordance with National Vision philosophy and established guidelines.
What would you do? – The Specifics
Manages the end-to-end instructional design process to create learning solutions.
Analyzes requirements for each learning solution (business and training needs, audience, content, delivery method, branding, etc.).
Creates engaging instructional materials—including e-learning content, storyboards, audio/video
scripts, facilitator and participant guides, job aids, assessments and quizzes, descriptions of concepts/processes/principles, procedural steps, and simulations—by incorporating adult learning principles and systematic design approaches.
Designs, develops, and evaluates training deliverables for a variety of learning styles and various delivery methods (instructor-led, virtual classroom, e-learning, video, etc.).
Updates instructional materials in accordance with policy and/or criteria changes.
Assists in pilots and make appropriate revisions to learning materials based on pilot results.
Assists in the development of management education learning solutions.
Manages the review cycle and coordinates review-related activities with subject matter experts (SMEs), project stakeholders, other members of the Organizational Development team, and learners to ensure client’s needs and expectations are met.
Works with Learning Management System (LMS) Administrator to ensure e-learning materials are uploaded and function as intended.
Acts as a positive and effective liaison between the Retail Support Center (RSC) and the retail field in championing corporate initiatives.
Assists in the interviewing, selection, and onboarding of new Organizational Development associates.
Position Requirements:

Four year college degree, or equivalent experience in Instructional Design, Organizational Development,
HR Development or related field OR equivalent National Vision Inc. experience.
1+ years of related experience creating training deliverables for retail organization is preferred.
Optical retail experience is preferred.
Excellent communication (verbal, written, and interpersonal) skills; should possess solid foundation in
English grammar with composition, editing and proofreading skills.
Knowledge of adult learning principles, instructional design methodologies and ROI (preferred).
Ability to quickly understand and assimilate company, brand, and industry specific content.
Professional certifications in instructional design or related discipline is a plus
Active membership in related professional industry group(s) is a plus
Advanced: Presentation/PowerPoint, Spreadsheet, Word Processing/Typing
Intermediate: Database
Proficiency with e-learning authoring tools (Adobe Captivate, Articulate Storyline, etc.).
Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud applications (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects, etc.).
Experience with learning management systems (Cornerstone preferred).
Experience with virtual classroom software (WebEx preferred).
Familiarity with HTML is a plus
Dependability: Takes personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work.
Member of Cross-functional Team: Can effectively work as part of a team and work with others across the organization to achieve a common goal.
Time Management: Excellent organization, planning, judgment, and time management skills.
Oral and Written Communication: Effectively conveys information and ideas in concise and meaningful exchanges through written and verbal communication.
Results Orientated: Able to achieve task completion and meet schedules, deadlines, quotas and performance goals.
Creativity Thinking: Develops fresh ideas that provide solutions to all types of workplace challenges.
Minimal travel, 20%.
What are the benefits?
National Vision offers a competitive benefits package including Health and Dental Insurance, 401k with company match, Flex Spending Account, Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Personal Time Off, and much more. Please see our website www.nationalvision.com to learn more.

Title: Sr SAP Basis Admin
FullDescriptions:
Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization
The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.
That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.
Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?
Senior SAP/DB Admin
The Sr. SAP Basis Administrator is a member of the SAP BASIS Operations team in the Honeywell IT Enterprise Systems and Applications organization, which ensures alignment and delivery of all SAP services for the Honeywell Corporation and Strategic Business Groups (SBG). Support of SAP is an integral component in the delivery of both business efficiencies and tangible benefits given that it is the ERP system of choice across the Honeywell businesses enabling an integrated approach involving systems, processes, and people. The Sr. SAP Basis Administrator will integrate the latest SAP technologies, products and infrastructure components to run the best in class SAP solutions to deliver business value.

Position:
The Sr. SAP Basis Administrator will consult and provide technical solutions to meet the SBG requirements, improve system performance and address chronic issues. This position requires expert knowledge and experience working in a large multi-instance SAP Environment.
Must Have:
BS in Computer Science/Mathematics or relevant IT/Engineering field required.
10-15 years of experience with SAP Basis Administration support in a large Enterprise environment
We Value:
Expert in architecting and supporting solutions around SAP ecosystems and a technology stack of SAP Enterprise Core Component (ECC), Business Intelligence (BI), Enterprise Portal (EP), SAP HANA, Suite on HANA, BW on HANA, SLD, Process Integration (PI/PO), Fiori, CRM, EWM, LVM, Solution Manager, BOBJ BI/BODS, GRC, TREX, JAVA systems etc.
Strong hands-on experience with SAP Basis tasks such as designing and implementing landscape and infrastructure, client strategy, capacity planning (sizing), high-availability and disaster-recovery setup, backup and recovery strategy, storage systems, SAP upgrades, OS/DB migration, System refresh & client copies and Basis administration.
Experienced in SAP implementation, upgrades and migrations to Suite on HANA, BW on HANA, and cloud integration, cloud migrations.
Strong knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systems. Knowledge should include performance analysis and debugging. Deep level of knowledge on HA/DR technologies including design and implementation of Geographically Dispersed HA/DR solutions.
Strong knowledge of Database Administration. Deep knowledge including performance query analysis, sizing, HA/DR and storage/disk design of SAP HANA, Oracle, MaxDB.
Strong experience with Hyper-Visor/Cloud/Networking: Able to design, deploy and troubleshoot solutions based on VMWare or Azure or AWS.
Strong experience with planning, design, installation, and technical configuration of SAP modules and components.
Experienced with complex SAP and non-SAP technical integration and monitoring solutions for SAP applications and platforms.
Strong knowledge of Instance, database and query tuning to improve the performance of the database/application.
Strong experience with operations of large-scale global SAP landscapes.
Ability to work individually (self-motivated) and within a team environment.
Experience managing multiple IT initiatives and multiple teams spread across various geographic locations
Experience defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines
Adept at designing and implementing technology-enabled business solutions for a large enterprise as part of a high-talent team and as a team lead or Manager on at least 3+ full cycle SAP Implementations/Upgrade projects
Additional Information
Category: Information Technology
Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E., Atlanta, GA 30308 USA
Exempt

FullDescriptions:
Overview of the Financial System Support Specialist:

This position is responsible for the creation and maintenance of all company item master and user/associate records within the Oracle ERP system. This includes timely and accurate set-up of items, information, gathering and retaining supporting documentation, reporting and auditing. This position is also responsible for the set up and maintenance of the EAM module in Oracle. Under guidance and direction of a finance manager, the Financial System Support Administrator is responsible for maintaining database integrity and interfacing with company finance, information technology, sales, and marketing and operations personnel.

Responsiblities:

Maintain, review and input Oracle item master with regulatory and internal data standards and record-keeping guidelines.
Collect and retain related and supporting documentation.
Engage business users spanning multiple business units and ensure cohesive articulation of business goals and processes to ensure effective technology solutions
Provided day to day Oracle Applications support to end users which includes troubleshooting and resolving Oracle Financials related issues.
Liaison between Finance, Accounting, and the IT department
Help drive creative effective solutions to business problems
Verify integrity and accuracy of data fields and data output.
Research and resolve issues and root causes related to data exceptions.
Properly handle confidential company and supplier information.
Interface with company finance, information technology, sales, and marketing and operations personnel.
Support other data set up and maintenance, as assigned by assigned by supervisor.
Manage personal development needs in anticipation of business requirements.
Set up and maintain Vehicle data within the EAM module of oracle.
Maintain, review and set up Purchasing Hierarchies, Buyers, Approval Groups, and assign Approval Groups to positions.
Establish, document, and enforce guidelines and procedures for items.
Maintain documentation for the set up of vehicles win the EAM system.
Research and resolve issues and root causes related to EAM exceptions.
Provide Inventory training when necessary.
Help drive creative effective solutions to business problems

Who we are

DS Services is a national direct-to-consumer provider of bottled water, office coffee and water filtration services. DS Services offers a comprehensive portfolio of beverage products, equipment and supplies to approximately 1.5 million customers through its network of over 210 sales and distribution facilities and daily operation of over 2,100 routes. With one of the broadest distribution networks in the country, DS Services can provide service to approximately 90 percent of U.S. households and efficiently services homes and national, regional and local offices. DS Services is dedicated to achieving its mission of becoming America's favorite water, coffee and tea service provider where consumers live, work and play. Please visit our website www.water.com for more information about DS Services. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

Title: DBA III, Infrastructure
FullDescriptions:
Overview
Leveraging deep integrations into retailers’ point-of-sale systems, InComm is revolutionizing the commerce experience through innovative payments technology. InComm leverages end to end solutions to bring branded activatable products to retailers both in store and digitally. Our process includes everything from card printing, inventory management and forecast analytics, to the development and integration of activation technology in point of sale machines world-wide. From there we leverage our backend platform as a service technology to drive product activation to the tune of several thousand card activations every second. Whether those consumers are activating prepaid products, paying bills, enjoying real-time discounts through a membership card, purchasing digital goods in-store or adding funds to an online account, InComm is there to provide unique gift-gifting opportunities, cater to on-the-go shoppers, deliver added value through loyalty programs and serve cash-based consumers.

InComm is headquartered in Atlanta, GA with a presence in over 30 countries, an organization of approximately 3,000 employees, several hundred international technical patents, and a network that includes over 600,000 points of retail distribution. With innovation as our number 1 company value, our speed to market for new products and services is accelerating rapidly and quickly positioning InComm as a global leader in fintech innovation. Learn more at www.incomm.com or connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, or Our Blog.

Inside InComm from InComm on Vimeo.
Responsibilities
The Oracle Database Administrator is responsible for installing and administering Oracle database RAC and standalone instances in all environment including but not limited to development, quality assurance, test and production. The incumbent is responsible to manage all oracle databases and applications, manage all database objects, make sure no problems in Oracle database, manage database replications for reporting and for disaster recovery systems.

Creates and maintains all databases required for development, testing, pre-prod and production usage
Install new versions of the Oracle database and its tools and any other tools that access the Oracle database.
Setting up Golden Gate replication, Monitoring and administration.
Plans and implements backup and recovery of the Oracle database.
OEM configuration, monitoring and administration
Database patch management
Controls migration of programs, database changes, reference data changes through the development life cycle
Implements and enforces security for all Oracle Databases.
Performs database re-organizations as required to assist performance and ensure maximum uptime of the database.
Performs the capacity planning required to create and maintain the databases. The DBA works closely with system administration staff because computers often have applications or tools on them in addition to the Oracle database
Performs ongoing database and application performance tuning
Puts standards in place to ensure that all application design and code is produced with proper integrity, security and performance. The DBA will perform reviews on the design and code frequently to ensure the new codes follow the standards and will not create problems.
Evaluates releases of Oracle and its tools, and third party products to ensure that the company is running the products that are most appropriate. Planning is also performed by the DBA, along with the application developers and System administrators, to ensure that any new product usage or release upgrade takes place with minimal impact.
Provides technical support to application development teams. The DBA is usually the point of contact for all Oracle related requests
Enforces and maintains database constraints to ensure integrity of the database.
Administers all database objects, including tables, clusters, indexes, views, sequences, packages and procedures.
Assists with impact analysis of any changes made to the database objects.
Troubleshoots with problems regarding the databases, applications and development tools.
Support projects that required Oracle database. Create new database users as required.
Manage sharing of resources amongst applications.
The DBA has ultimate responsibility for the physical database design.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Information System, Computer Science or work equivalent
A minimum of 7 -10 years of Oracle DBA support experience.
A minimum of 7 years of database support and design experience and migration/upgrade experience with Oracle.
Experience with the recent Oracle databases version. Experience working with Oracle RAC cluster and 12c database, preferable with multi-tenant architecture.
Work experience with installing and supporting Golden Gate, and configuring Golden Gate to be used as replication tool.
Oracle DBA and Oracle Golden Gate certification preferred.
A good troubleshooting skills, and have experience in application and database performance tuning.
A good knowledge of LINUX and Windows operating system(s)
A good ability to develop & read UNIX script
A good knowledge of physical database design
Ability to perform both Oracle and operating system performance monitoring and the necessary adjustments.
Able to provide a strategic database direction for the organization
Excellent knowledge of Oracle backup and recovery scenarios.
A good working knowledge HA solutions Data Guard and active Data Guard.
A good knowledge & experience in using and configuring OEM
Good skills in all Oracle tools.
A good knowledge of Oracle security management.
A good knowledge of how Oracle acquires and manages resources.
Experience and knowledge in migrating code, database changes and data through the various stages of the development life cycle
A good knowledge of the way Oracle enforces data integrity.

KSA (Knowledge; Skills; Abilities):

Ability to work a team dynamic that delivers a high availability service
Demonstrated ability to document standard procedures, problems resolutions and environment modifications
Strong interpersonal skills and good written and verbal communication skill
Maintain high standards of work and composure in challenging situations
Ability to follow all company policies and procedures as well as internal departmental procedures to ensure consistency in systems
Ability to investigate and assess issues to make certain the correct solution is implemented
Willingness to take ownership for own work to continuously improve performance
Excellent presentation and communication skills both verbal and written
Demonstrated ability to advance project timelines and effectively communicate status updates to stakeholders

Title: Database Administrator - Associate
FullDescriptions:
About this role
About the role:
You can work with us at one of the world’s top FinTech companies. We sell our Aladdin platform to over 200 of the top global corporations, in total managing about quarter of all the world’s money under management. You can help build, monitor, support and administer some of the software which drives the global economy.

But we’re also looking for those who don’t yet have that experience, but are passionate about getting there; we know that every great career has a first step.

Title: Database Administrator - ICL
Qualifications:

Strong cloud experience with database technologies, preferably AWS

Strong written, verbal and presentation skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are necessary

FullDescriptions:
ICL’s Trusted and Inter-operable Systems and Architecture Division is looking for a NoSQL Database Administrator with 5+ years of hands-on experience managing database operations preferably with a NoSQL database in a cloud environment. This position must be able to collaborate across teams including Enterprise Architecture, DevOps, Infrastructure, and Security to help elicit, design, and implement functional and non-functional database requirements. Must be able to lead the conversation and apply best practices with respect to database infrastructure, performance, capacity, backup, security, high-availability, and disaster recovery and steer the team to success. The ideal candidate would like to work in a cutting-edge research software development environment.

The primary work assignment would be as an information architect for Government projects serving the Justice, Public Safety, Health, and DOD Command and Control (C2) communities. Projects focus on secure sharing of information between state, local, and federal agency information systems, focusing on standards development and information sharing systems and tools. Each agency we work with is autonomous and has a unique architecture and legacy infrastructure. GTRI serves as the principal architect and integrator and provides technical guidance to numerous agencies and contractors.

The project is based in the Centergy Building at 75 Fifth Street NW Atlanta, on the Georgia Tech campus.

Job Duties
Support the design, sizing, and build of the MarkLogic Operational Data Store in multiple environments within an AWS cloud architecture
Design and perform automated build and upgrades of the database and integrate with DevOps continuous integration effort
Determine system storage requirements for the database
Design, implement, and enforce database security measures
Monitor and optimize the performance of the database
Support planning and implementation for backups, high-availability, and disaster recovery
Ensure compliance with database vendor license agreement
Support developing a plan to conduct database unit and system tests, monitors results, and take corrective action
Ensure compliance with the selected database standards
Participate in design and implementation of standards, tools and methodologies
Travel Requirements
<10% travel

Education & Length of Experience
Research Engineer/Scientist/Technologist/Associate I

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Management of Technology, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or related field of study.
Required Minimum Qualifications
Strong NoSQL knowledge including administration, infrastructure, and deployment best practices
Strong cloud experience with database technologies, preferably AWS
Experience working as part of a data team on large matrixed projects
Experience designing database infrastructure for high-availability and performance in a mission critical system
Experience working closely with DevOps, Security and Operations in an agile environment
Experience on large integration projects
Strategic thinker with desire to be hands-on
Knowledge of current and emerging technologies
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are necessary
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with MarkLogic
Experience with Medicaid Management Information Systems, Health IT standards, policies, and best practices is a strong plus
Experience in building containerized applications
Experience with REST based microservices
Understanding of agile development CI/CD toolkit
U.S. Citizenship Requirements
Due to our research contracts with the US federal government, candidates for this position are required to be US Citizens.

Ability to obtain Secret Clearance upon hire

Title: IT Server Administrator
FullDescriptions:
Title: IT Server Administrator
Location: Norcross, GA
Job Description:
The Server Administrator's role is to design, install, administer, and optimize company servers and related components to achieve high performance of the various business applications supported by tuning the servers as necessary. This includes ensuring the availability of client/server applications, configuring all new implementations, and developing processes and procedures for ongoing management of the server environment. Where applicable, the Server Administrator will assist in overseeing the physical security, integrity, and safety of the data center/server farm.
Essential Skill/Knowledge Functions:
1. Manage servers, including e-mail, print, and backup servers and their associated operating systems and software.
2. Establish and implement policies, procedures, and technologies to ensure server security.
3. Conduct research on server hardware, software, and protocols in support of procurement and development efforts.
4. Check service desk database for entries on server and server resource issues; prioritize and respond to service desk tickets as appropriate.
5. Serve as cornerstone for escalating server issues; provide timely response to customer escalations.
6. Perform file system configuration and management; define and perform server backups and recovery procedures.
7. Monitor and test system performance and provide performance statistics and reports.
8. Manage enterprise directory services and supporting server infrastructure.
9. Define and implement strategies for integrating disparate operating environments.
10. Recommend and execute modifications to server environment in order to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance.
11. Deploy new applications and enhancements to existing applications, software, and operating systems.
12. Collaborate with network staff to ensure smooth and reliable operation of software and systems for fulfilling business objectives and processes.
Job-Specific Essential Skill/Knowledge Functions:
1. Advanced knowledge of at least 3 of the following: W2K8-W2K19 Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, VMWare, Hypver-V, Azure, Exchange, SQL, Veeam Backup, WYSE operating systems or Microsoft printing.
2. Working knowledge of Microsoft SCOM, SCCM, SCVMM, SCSM, W2K8, W2K12, W2K16, W2K19, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, VMWare, Hypver-V, Azure, Exchange, SQL, Veeam Backup, WYSE operating systems,Active Directory, Microsoft Endpoint Protection, Microsoft printing.
3. Experience installing, configuring, and maintaining all manners of server hardware and associated network equipment, including SCSI, RAID, and I/O topology.
4. Experience with server performance tuning and monitoring tools.
5. Proven experience in overseeing the design and implementation of Microsoft based systems for application delivery and related products.
6. Working technical knowledge of current hardware, software protocols, and Internet standards
7. Excellent hardware and software troubleshooting experience.
LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION, EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
1. Bachelors in Computer Science or other fields with 3 years of IT related work experience
2. MCSA, MCSE certifications
At PruittHealth, Committed to Caring isnt simply a tagline, its the way we do business and its ingrained in our culture. At PruittHealth, we dont hire employees we welcome partners!
Since its inception in 1969, PruittHealth has been a family-owned innovative organization committed to providing exceptional care across a wide spectrum of services including: skilled nursing care, assisted & independent living, home health care, end-of-life hospice care, rehabilitation, pharmacy/infusion services and more.

Today, the organization is the 14th largest skilled nursing provider in the United States, spans across the Southeast, touches 170 communities, cares for 24,000 patients daily, and is driven by 16,000 passionate partners.

# LI- SG3

Title: Molecular Epidemiology Laboratory Fellowship
Qualifications:
Master’s or PhD in a biological science or public health field received within the last five years
Prior experience with biorepository establishment, database structure and management is highly desirable.
Prior experience with molecular biology methods including next generation sequencing is highly preferable.
Requirement:
Degree: Master's Degree or Doctoral Degree received within the last 60 month(s).
Discipline(s):
Computer Sciences (1 )
Engineering (2 )
Life Health and Medical Sciences (47 )
FullDescriptions:
Organization Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Reference Code CDC-CVDB-2018-0058
How to Apply
A complete application consists of:
An application
Transcripts – Click here for detailed information about acceptable transcripts
A current resume/CV, including academic history, employment history, relevant experiences, and publication list
Two educational or professional references
All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.
If you have questions, send an email to CDCrpp@orau.org. Please include the reference code for this opportunity in your email.
Description
An opportunity is available in the Chronic Viral Diseases Branch of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in Atlanta, Georgia.
Under the guidance of a mentor, the selected participant will join laboratory staff in projects related to Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (CFS) and Human Papillomavirus (HPV). S/he will participate with multi-site clinical studies, biorepository establishment, and development of specimen management databases, specimen processing, molecular testing, sequence and data analyses, and laboratory quality management system. Specific training opportunities may include:
Development/management of biorepository databases like Freezerworks. This can involve building adequate IT infrastructure to track and monitor specimen location, handling, processing, checking-in and checking-out of biological materials and associated data sets representing a number of large-scale case-control and longitudinal studies. Develop specimen life-cycle attributes with the knowledge of relational database structure.Cataloguing, processing, and storing biologic samples while observing all safety guidelinesNucleic acid extraction (DNA and RNA), purification and evaluation of qualityLaboratory testing that employs a variety of molecular techniques (such as PCR, real-time PCR, and next generation sequencing) related to genotyping, gene copy number determination, DNA methylation and gene expression projects; metabolic, cytokine and other assays may also be studied. Participate in assay optimization and development to carry out molecular epidemiologic studies.Documentation of laboratory activities, data, summariesQuality control and safety procedures necessary for the performance of laboratory protocols and working with biohazard materialsParticipate in laboratory quality management activities
This program, administered by ORAU through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education, was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and CDC. The initial appointment is for one year, but may be renewed upon recommendation of CDC contingent on the availability of funds. The participant will receive a monthly stipend commensurate with educational level and experience. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. The appointment is full-time at CDC in the Atlanta, Georgia, area. Participants do not become employees of CDC, DOE or the program administrator, and there are no employment-related benefits.

Qualifications
Master’s or PhD in a biological science or public health field received within the last five years
Prior experience with biorepository establishment, database structure and management is highly desirable.
Prior experience with molecular biology methods including next generation sequencing is highly preferable.

Eligibility Requirements
Degree: Master's Degree or Doctoral Degree received within the last 60 month(s).
Discipline(s):
Computer Sciences (1 )
Engineering (2 )
Life Health and Medical Sciences (47 )

Title: WIC Vendor Performance Senior Analyst
Qualifications:
Master's Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Public Health or Statistics.
Cost Modeling Experience.
Database Management skills: Oracle, SQL, Access.
Must have strong SAS skills with at least 2 years of experience with custom programming.
Ability to manipulate large datasets as well as leverage/write SAS/Macro, SAS/Stat and stored procedures.
3 years data analysis, reporting and data driven strategy recommendations experience.
Must be proficient with Microsoft Office products (specifically Access, Excel).
Experience coordinating data gathering and synthesis across a large number of diverse participants.
Public sector and/or Grocery industry experience.
Responsibilities:
Runs analysis to validate the integrity of vendor system data and works with team to ensure appropriate corrective action is taken.
Provides detailed analysis and evaluation of vendor activity to identify trends and potential compliance issues (e.g., identification of vendors with WIC sales greater than 50% of total sales, high risk vendor analysis, spikes in reimbursement, peer group analysis),
Works regularly with Information Technology team regarding the development, implementation and monitoring of effective vendor management technology systems to drive maximum automation and increase data quality and integrity.
Prepares regular, robust reports and analysis to monitor vendor activity and compliance; shares reports with appropriate leadership and team members; creates special reports and analysis as needed.
Prepares vendor performance reports required by USDA within the specified timeframes.
Provides insight and input on updating WIC policies and guidelines related to vendor management.
Works regularly across the WIC program and DPH to identify opportunities to improve vendor data analysis and reporting and to increase vendor compliance.
Participates as requested in the Vendor Advisory Group to enhance communication, awareness and collaboration on vendor related policy, procedures and support.
Performs other assignments as required.
FullDescriptions:
Description
Pay Grade: M

The Georgia Department of Public Health is the lead agency entrusted by the people of the state of Georgia with the ultimate responsibility for the health of communities and the entire population.

The agency is seeking a highly qualified candidate for the position of WIC Vendor Performance Senior Analyst within the Division of Health Promotion/Women, Infants and Children (WIC) section.

The Vendor Performance Senior Analyst is responsible for providing detailed vendor management data analysis and reporting to optimize data integrity and monitor vendor compliance for the Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program to help ensure adherence to state and federal regulations and provide trustworthy retail locations for WIC participants to reimburse their food vouchers. This position reports to the WIC Vendor Analytics and Cost Containment Manager.
Job Responsibilities
Runs analysis to validate the integrity of vendor system data and works with team to ensure appropriate corrective action is taken.
Provides detailed analysis and evaluation of vendor activity to identify trends and potential compliance issues (e.g., identification of vendors with WIC sales greater than 50% of total sales, high risk vendor analysis, spikes in reimbursement, peer group analysis),
Works regularly with Information Technology team regarding the development, implementation and monitoring of effective vendor management technology systems to drive maximum automation and increase data quality and integrity.
Prepares regular, robust reports and analysis to monitor vendor activity and compliance; shares reports with appropriate leadership and team members; creates special reports and analysis as needed.
Prepares vendor performance reports required by USDA within the specified timeframes.
Provides insight and input on updating WIC policies and guidelines related to vendor management.
Works regularly across the WIC program and DPH to identify opportunities to improve vendor data analysis and reporting and to increase vendor compliance.
Participates as requested in the Vendor Advisory Group to enhance communication, awareness and collaboration on vendor related policy, procedures and support.
Performs other assignments as required.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field from an accredited college or university AND Two years of experience in support of an operating system, database management system or a related field OR Two years of experience at the lower level Database Administrator 1 (ITP030) or position equivalent.

Preferred Qualifications
Master's Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Public Health or Statistics.
Cost Modeling Experience.
Database Management skills: Oracle, SQL, Access.
Must have strong SAS skills with at least 2 years of experience with custom programming.
Ability to manipulate large datasets as well as leverage/write SAS/Macro, SAS/Stat and stored procedures.
3 years data analysis, reporting and data driven strategy recommendations experience.
Must be proficient with Microsoft Office products (specifically Access, Excel).
Experience coordinating data gathering and synthesis across a large number of diverse participants.
Public sector and/or Grocery industry experience.
Additional Information
Georgia Department of Public Health Commissioner and leaders encourage all employees to engage in regular wellness activities and to make lifestyle choices that promote health and well-being.

The use of wellness breaks during the workday is authorized to support this philosophy and assist employees in meeting their wellness goals. A maximum of 30 minutes in a given workday may be used to engage in wellness activities, generally in the form of two 15-minute breaks or one 30-minute break.

Employment Information

Current State employees are subject to State Personnel Board rules regarding salary.

DPH accepts educational credential recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) and/or the US Department of Education (DOE) will be considered. DPH will contact educational institutions to verify degree, diploma, licensure, etc.

The candidate selected for this position may be subject to pre-employment drug screening and a criminal background check.

As an employee of DPH, in the event of an identified emergency you may be required, as a term and condition of employment, to assist in meeting the emergency responsibilities of the department.

If you require accommodations under the American Disability Act (ADA), email request by the closing date of this announcement to: DPH-HR@dph.ga.gov.

DPH is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Due to the volume of applications received, we are unable to provide information on application status by phone or e-mail. All qualified applicants will be considered, but may not necessarily receive an interview. Selected applicants will be contacted by the hiring agency for next steps in the selection process. Applicants who are not selected will not receive notification.

This position is subject to close at any time once a satisfactory applicant pool has been identified.

5 years of Server and Database Administration (DBA) Support

Support for ongoing consolidation efforts (hardware, functional, and system)
